narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Amrutasri Ashwini Nori-Sarma  Great job! Amruta complemented the in-class discussions and was always very helpful and swift to respond to questions. She put a lot of effort into the class. Great TA!

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I would suggest that this course is available as a full semester module instead of half semester. I would have liked to have more time for in-class discussion and debate -- 1 hour for 5 weeks is rather short!
N/A

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Flexibility of the course by offering both in-class and online discussions/material. It gave non-FES students great opportunity to learn a bit of many very current topics!
Ethics framing for thinking about environmental problems should be mandatory for all future environmental leaders!
In class debate
The debate was a great exercise for people to take on views that they don't necessarily agree with. At FES we are so used to sharing opinions with our peers, and that can be detrimental
The readings, videos, format of this course was perfect. The readings and videos were well-curated and Prof Bell facilitated great discussion.
Class discussions were interesting. It was nice to have the flexibility of watching lectures online on my own time and only having class once per week.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The readings were quite tough for a non-native English speaker. But given that this is the minority, I fully understand that this can't be considered.

My biggest complaint about this course was that people didn't take it as seriously as they should. Because the class was partially online, and was a 2-credit pass/fail course - it was clear that most students placed this course below their other ones on the priorities list. Most people waited until the last moment to do their online discussion posts - which defeats the purpose because by the time there is enough material to have an actual conversation about it, it's too late. It's also unfair to the students who do the assignment within a reasonable amount of time to allow for others to comment (since commenting back and forth is part of the requirement). The environmental community needs courses like this because we have a tendency to ignore things like ethics and communication. There are so few FES courses that are dedicated to these issues, and it's a shame to see one of the only ones be so disregarded by students because they see it as an easy pass. On the other hand, if the "easy A" is what gets people in the door, I guess I'd rather them take this course than not at all. It was just frustrating for me because I put more work into this class than most of my peers.

I think the discussion sections were too short - that is my only critique about this class. I would have preferred to have a richer, lengthier in-person discussion rather than a commenting on a class discussion thread.
The debates and class presentations were not that useful for my learning and felt a little too elementary for a master's level class.
Less work the last 2 weeks of class, it seemed to pile on too much at the end of the course, on top of the group presentation.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: I think it was effective, although it could probably be more so if more people really participated in the online discussion, instead of doing it half-hearted and late (or not at all).

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I highly recommend this class to any SOM student! It's a great introduction into ethical issues from an environmental perspective. Fabulous course!
This is one of the few courses that does fit into my program, my focus is on environmental communication, so ethics and courses that encourage debate and thoughtful reflection are vital.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To experience an "FES class".

This course was a great chance for me to learn more about environmental ethics, as seen by my peers. I had already taken courses on ethics/similar topics, so I was familiar with the material. However I did learn more, and I also learned a lot about my peers and how they see issues like what we discussed in class.

I think everyone should take this course. It puts a lot of our learning (regardless of which specific field you're pursuing) into perspective and raises important issues about environmental justice and ethics.
I wanted a 1/2 semester class and to learn something totally new

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: My expectations were exceeded!
Yes!
Yes, because I learned quite a bit about my peers and the FES community.
Yes, exceeded expectations.
Yes!
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: It was interesting to work with non-SOM students. I could clearly notice strengths and weaknesses of each of us.
I thought the final presentation group work was excellent. It was a little harder to prepare for the debate as a group.

Advantages to group work in courses like this are that you get different perspectives and you have to work together to find common ground or find agreement. This was especially helpful in the debate when people had to take views that they didn't necessarily agree with. However, group work in this course was unlike other group projects I've had at FES. My peers regarded this class as not as important as other classes, so working in groups was also half-hearted.
Oppotunity to learn about differnt perspectivces

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: TAKE IT!!
I would recommend this course
Wonderful course! I highly recommend to everyone, regardless of what you're studying specifically.

Absolutely take this course, it is important to identify the values that underlie the environmental field and the ones that guide us in our everyday lives. This course crams a lot of useful information into a short amount of time and it's well worth taking if you need a 1 unit course.
